treatment.description: Leaf blades narrowly oblanceolate to spatulate, tomentose abaxially, less so adaxially. Flowers 5–9 mm; perianth yellow to ochro-leucous, sparsely to densely villous abaxially.
treatment.habitat: sandy to gravelly or rocky flats and slopes
treatment.discussion: Variety douglasii is widespread in scattered, disjunct populations in southeastern Washington (Columbia, Douglas, Ferry, Kittitas, Klickitat, and Yakima counties) and northeastern Oregon (Baker, Gilliam, Grant, Jefferson, Malheur, Sherman, Union, Wallowa, and Wasco counties).
